page.title: 02Cockerham Primary School
page.content: The School in Cockerham dates originally from l68l, when it was situated in the north-east corner of the churchyard. The present site on Main Street consists of a stone-built building (1829) with a brick built extention(1958);which comprises 3 classrooms,hall,staffroom,entrance hall,kitchen,toilets and caretaker's room.The School is a Church of England Voluntary-Aided Primary School and has 55 pupils on roll.The staff include the Headteacher,2 full time teachers,1 part time teacher and a non-teaching assistant,together with other ancillary help.There are 3 mixed age and ability classes.The curriculum is broadly based on general studies,and includes Computer & Environmental Studies.A recent HMI Report describes the School as "a well organised purposeful primary school
